intro: Bassia sedifolia, commonly known as silverleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine hairs that help reduce water loss. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas or along roadsides. Its drought tolerance makes it a hardy species adapted to harsh, semi-arid environments.
